SENT.plain: Lupus is a multisystem disease with varied clinical manifestations
Cavitary lung lesions in lupus could be secondary to infections, embolism, or underlying vasculitis
We report a man who presented with lung cavitations and was diagnosed as lupus, secondary antiphospholipid syndrome, and plasma cell dyscrasia
The lesions resolved after the initiation of immunosuppressive therapy
All the previous case reports have been reviewed and the possible mechanisms underlying this association are discussed
